text:
The Industrial and Mining Water Research Unit (abbreviated IMWaRU) is a research group. They are part of the School of Chemical and Metallurgical Engineering at the University of the Witwatersrand, Johannesburg.
Unit Structure.
The unit deals with many water issues in industry and mining.
Collaboration.
The unit works with the Schools of Law, Chemistry, Civil and Mining engineering at the University.
Location.
The main location IMWaRU is in the Richard Ward Building on the East campus of the University.

annotations.surface_form: School of Chemical and Metallurgical Engineering
